meanings.definition: The act of lowering the value or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: The debasements of the artwork made it less valuable.
meanings.sent2: The debasements of the currency led to economic instability.
meanings.sent3: The debasements of the cake recipe resulted in a strange taste.
meanings.sent4: Her constant debasements of his achievements hurt his self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The debasements of the once beautiful garden left it in ruins.

meanings.definition: The state of being degraded or humiliated.
meanings.sent1: He felt the debasements of his reputation deeply.
meanings.sent2: The debasements she endured at work were unfair.
meanings.sent3: The debasements of the clown's performance made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The debasements of the team's spirit affected their performance.
meanings.sent5: The debasements of her character in the play brought tears to the audience.
